settings.label: Xero - General
settings.comment: For detailed instructions please refer to the Fooman Connect:Xero User Manual here.

consumerkey.label: Consumer Key
consumerkey.tooltip: Copy and paste the Xero Oauth Consumer Key from step 2 of the user manual into this field.

consumersecret.label: Consumer Secret
consumersecret.tooltip: Copy and paste the Xero Oauth Consumer Secret from step 2 of the user manual into this field.

privatekey.label: Private Key
privatekey.tooltip: This will be automatically populated in step 1 of the user manual. Alternatively you can create your own SSL certificate and enter the private key here.

privatekeypassword.label: Password of Private Key
privatekeypassword.tooltip: Leave this field empty if you followed the directions in step 1 of the user manual. If you chose to use your own SSL certificate, paste the password of the private key here, if applicable.

xeroversion.label: Xero Version
xeroversion.tooltip: Select the Xero version you are using from the drop down list.

xeronumbering.label: Use Xero Numbers
xeronumbering.tooltip: When set to "Yes", orders/credit memos exported to Xero will use the Xero assigned number rather than the Magento assigned number.

xerotransfercurrency.label: Transfer Currency
xerotransfercurrency.tooltip: Choose to export orders/credit memos in store base currency or order currency.

usecompany.label: Prefer Company as Contact
usecompany.tooltip: When set to "Yes" and the billing address contains a company this will be used as the contact name in Xero instead of First Name + Last Name of the customer.

xerotracking.label: Tracking
xerotracking.tooltip: Use this setting if you already use tracking categories in Xero and want to track your online sales channel. Choose a tracking option to record online transactions exported to Xero.

xerologenabled.label: Enable Logging
xerologenabled.tooltip: If Magento logging is enabled and this option is enabled log messages are written to /var/log/xero.log

xeroenablereset.label: Enable Reset
xeroenablereset.tooltip: When set to "Yes", an extra button will be created on the Fooman Connect: Xero pages allowing you to reset the export status and link to the invoice/credit memo in Xero (for example, after finishing test exports to a Xero demo company).

codesale.label: Sales Account
codesale.tooltip:
Select the Xero account where you want to record sales. This setting applies on a per store level, and can be manually overridden on an individual product level by doing the following:
• Go to Catalog > Manage Products
• Click into the product that you wish to individually configure a different Xero Sales Account for
• In the newly added field "Xero Sales Account Code", select the Xero account where you want to record sales for this item
• Repeat for every product you wish to manually override

codeshipping.label: Shipping Account
codeshipping.tooltip: Select the Xero account where you want to record shipping.

shippingisexpenseaccount.label: Shipping is an Expense Account
shippingisexpenseaccount.tooltip: Enable this if the account above is an expense account in Xero - also requires payments to be enabled to this account.

coderefunds.label: Refund Adjustment Account
coderefunds.tooltip: Select the Xero account where you want to record adjustments on credit memos.

codesurcharge.label: Surcharge (Fooman)
codesurcharge.tooltip: Select the Xero account where you want to record surcharges.

codesagepaysurcharge.label: Surcharge (SagePay by Ebizmarts)
codesagepaysurcharge.tooltip: Select the Xero account where you want to record surcharges.

codeamgiftcards.label: Giftcard Account (Amasty)
codeamgiftcards.tooltip: Select the Xero account where you want to record gift card redemptions (Amasty GiftCard).

codephoenixcashondelivery.label: Cash On Delivery (Phoenix)
codephoenixcashondelivery.tooltip: Select the Xero account where you want to record the cash on delivery fee.

codecustomerbalance.label: Customer Balance Account (EE)
codecustomerbalance.tooltip: Select the Xero account where you want to record customer balance.

vaimoklarnafeeaccount.label: Invoice Fee Account (Vaimo)
vaimoklarnafeeaccount.tooltip: Select the Xero account where you want to record the Klarna invoice fee (Vaimo).

coderounding.label: Rounding Account
coderounding.tooltip: Confirm the Xero account to record rounding entries.

xerooverridetax.label: Tax Calculation
xerooverridetax.tooltip:
Unfortunately Magento and Xero do not always agree on how to calculate, differences exist in tax, rounding, bugs, etc. Xero will reject any data which does not match its expectations. Choose any of the following options:

• Magento Calculated = take Magento's value directly - requires it to calculate exactly like Xero to not get rejected
• Magento re-calculated = attempt to bridge the gap by creating rounding entries
• Magento merged = Combine multiple line items into one per tax type
• Xero re-calculated = let Xero recalculate completely based on the line total, could change qty to 1 if unit amounts with more than 3 digits can't be aligned

xerodefaultzerotaxrate.label: Default Tax Rate for None Taxed Items
xerodefaultzerotaxrate.tooltip: Select the tax rate to use when the item has no other tax rule applied and the tax amount is zero.

xeroexpensezerotaxrate.label: Tax Rate for None Taxed Items (Expenses)
xeroexpensezerotaxrate.tooltip: Select the tax rate to use when the item has no other tax rule applied and the tax amount is zero, only applicable for Expense Accounts

xerosurchargezero.label: Surcharge Tax Rate (Zero)
xerosurchargezero.tooltip: Choose your surcharge tax rate if no tax applies to the surcharge.

exportmode.label: Export Mode
exportmode.tooltip: The integration can either work by exporting Magento orders to Xero invoices (useful if Magento does not create the invoices straight away and with delayed payments) or by exporting Magento invoices to Xero invoices.

exportwithstatus.label: Export Orders with Status
exportwithstatus.tooltip: Choose which order status/statuses will be considered for the export to Xero. The first time a new order reaches this status, it will be exported to Xero. Multiple statuses can be selected (CTRL+click), as each order will only be exported once. Choose the status/statuses that best match the workflow of your payment methods and corresponds to money hitting your Xero accounts. Choosing to export orders with 'complete' status will be sufficient for most store's needs. However, please note that your payment method may use a different workflow to standard Magento so you should consider this. Compare your payment method workflow to standard Magento workflows using the information from the manual.

exportwithstatusinvoices.label: Export Invoices with Status
exportwithstatusinvoices.tooltip: Choose which invoice status/statuses will be considered for the export to Xero. The first time a new invoice reaches this status, it will be exported to Xero. Multiple statuses can be selected (CTRL+click), as each invoice will only be exported once.

xerostatus.label: Status in Xero
xerostatus.tooltip: We recommend keeping this as draft while testing the integration.

cancel.label: Delete/Void Invoices
cancel.tooltip: With this setting set to Yes when you cancel an order or invoice in Magento the corresponding invoice in Xero will automatically be deleted or voided (if the invoice has been approved in Xero).

payment.label: Create Payment
payment.tooltip: Automatically create a cash payment in Xero. The payment created is the full amount of the invoice. Depending on your payment processor the actual deposits can vary - see here for details

bankaccount.label: Bank Account for Payments
bankaccount.tooltip: This is the bank account the payment refund is deposited into. For credit cards this is the bank account funds are transferred into.

xeropayments.label: Show Xero payments on View page
xeropayments.tooltip:
When set to "Yes", a new tab called "Fooman Connect" will be shown in each individual order view page in Magento with:
  1. If the order has been exported to Xero
  2. If and on which date payment has been received (ie. whether the payment has been reconciled in Xero

exportzero.label: Export with Zero Amounts
exportzero.tooltip: When set to "Yes", zero amount orders (free products/items) will also be exported to Xero.

startdate.label: Start Date
startdate.tooltip: If you wish to backdate automatic exporting of orders, enter a date in this field. Dates should be entered in UTC (GMT) format. If no date is entered, automatic exporting will commence from the time of the process being set up and will not be backdated

startdate.label: Start Date
startdate.tooltip: If you wish to backdate automatic exporting of credit memos, enter a date in this field. Dates should be entered in UTC (GMT) format. If no date is entered, automatic exporting will commence from the time of the process being set up and will not be backdated

xeroprefix.label: Credit Note Prefix
xeroprefix.tooltip: Enter your chosen prefix to differentiate credit memo numbers from order numbers. While these numbers are the same in Magento, Xero requires these numbers to be unique.

xerostatus.label: Status in Xero
xerostatus.tooltip: We recommend keeping this as draft while testing the integration.

cashrefund.label: Create Cash Refund
cashrefund.tooltip: Automatically create a cash refund in Xero.

cashrefundbankaccount.label: Bank Account for Cash Refund
cashrefundbankaccount.tooltip: This is the bank account the cash refund is taken from. For credit cards this is the bank account funds are transferred into.

xeroautomatic.label: Enable Automatic Exports
xeroautomatic.comment: Please ensure you have configured a cronjob for Magento - read more.
xeroautomatic.tooltip: Even though the automatic export is scheduled to be run every 10 minutes, it cannot run faster than the system cron job. It is important to verify that a Magento cronjob was correctly configured during the initial set up of your Magento store, as this is essential to the automatic export function of Fooman Connect. If in doubt, please check with your web host or system administrator to confirm this.
